text: Good day everyone!I'm going to order an Adidas Superstar from JD Sports' store. However, I took a peek at their facebook page and saw customers complaining about their delivery in the comments (product not arriving/ unhelpful customer services etc.) Did you guys ordered from them before? Received the shoes successfully?

oledi got bad comment in fb, u still don't believe? Or, you want answer to hear what you want to hear, good arrive fast, good customer service, so, you reduce your guilt and stupidity if everything goes haywire? If I am you, I don't even consider at all
if u r in KL/selangor..or planning to go KL..just go to pavilion...they got a shop thr..

chill bro, I was just asking. Every deliver can't be 100% cepat dan tepat, maybe the few that commented are the ones that didn't get it. So the purpose of this thread is to ask who  that has a successful delivery.

I cool   I mean when there is too much negative comment, that will give you red flag, thread with caution with your hard earned money, unless u told me you have too much money to spare   then, I   u lor

I ordered once before. And yes, did not arrived at all as well as my other mates.The reason why is because they ship the product from UK to Malaysia. Maybe our item lost halfway reaching here.Anyway it's best for you to get your pair directly in pavilion, Sunway pyramid or Sunway velocity.
Thanks everyone
DamnI forgot to do research for their delivery issueI have order 2 pairs from UK and MY online store on 9/1/2017Until now did not receive anything.Now i expect the worst already.RM800++ GONE
u still didn't receive ur shoes.me also ordered from jd sport uk....got email that my shoes has bee despatched on 10.01,.2017.until now didn't received
I suggest u request for refund
If I order from Malaysia website but shipped from U.K. Would I get tax? Saw few complaint at fb actually
dear all, just want to ask did you guys receive your shoes as of today?
yes I would like to know too, those who commented have you guys received your orders? Also anyone else received their orders?

I ordered my shoes on Saturday February 25th and it arrived at my office on March 1st. The status of my order in JD's website still says my shoes are still in their warehouse until today.Edit: ohh and my shoes were shipped from the UK too.

ordered 2 pairs of nmds from jd malaysia website. didnt know items shipped from uk, suddenly got email from DHL asked to pay tax! worst part the shipper declared the items in GBP instead of MYR, had to pay tax for rm400!!! but they said can provide receipt for refund. still waiting now..btw the items status from their website still showing in warehouse. what a joke.. lucky they're using DHL as shipper.. took about 5 days to reach.. but no tracking or whatsoever..

this is my order as of now. TRACKDate / Time	Process	Event06 Mar 2017, 17:03:48PM	Item dispatched out PUSAT MEL NASIONAL	MPC PMIH (KLIA)06 Mar 2017, 09:52:27AM	Item held by Customs Awaiting presentation to customs commissioner	MPC PMIH (KLIA)06 Mar 2017, 09:51:27AM	Item processed at MPC PMIH (KLIA)	MPC PMIH (KLIA)23 Feb 2017, 21:00:00PM	Item dispatched out MPC PMIH (KLIA)	Sweden23 Feb 2017, 19:50:00PM	Item posted over the counter	Sweden

yes, direct link
Yup. Exact same experience here. 2 pairs of NMDs too. Also declared in GBP. Also kena 400+ GST and currently waiting for refund.http://jdsports.my/
Mine was via DHL.
is it because you choose express delivery?
Not at all. The odd thing was, express delivery was not available as an option during my check out.
when you say refund, do you mean JD will refund the tax or you are refunding the shoes?
Refund the taxes. If you want to return the shoes you need to ship them back to the UK.
May i know how you proceed to refund the tax?
You need to keep the tax documents provided to you by the courier. Scan these documents and email them to JD.
got my shoes already. worth a wait!
i get my 1 pair of nmd also today, i ordered at 2 march. i get my shoes directly without paying any tax. wondering why u guys need to pay tax?

by looking at the invoice, it never stated what currency are using. normally custom will imposed a tax if the amount exceeded rm1000. if you purchase 2 NMDs then it would be more than 1000 (560 x 2). if you buy 1 so still below. but well, subject to our luck also lorrrr. i heard a case where the customer purchase only rm300 but invoice come out GBP300 so obviously if base on currency exchange will be more than rm1000.
hi, they didnt reply my email when i want to proceed with the refund process! they replied urs?

when you receive the tracking number from them, you can track instantly @ directlink website? Because they gave me the tracking number and its already a week+ and I still cannot track it. When I message them keep saying already dispatch.

yes, i have the same feeling like yours as it was despatch on 23.2.17 but only appear in system around 5.3 when it reach Malaysia for custom clearance. you know, i even have email direct link customer svc and been tokd that the package already reach malaysia on 27.2.17. however, it actually only reach Malaysia on 5.3.17. subsequently it reach me on 8.3.17 after customs clearance, no additional tax to be paid of course. just sharing my experience.

Is anyone here know about local direct link delivery?Cos I don't hear and could not find any contact on website about local direct link delivery?Is they service fast and good?I ordered shoes from jd sport online also?and I check my tracking status stated my package now lodged with local delivery agent.

I ordered one pair of NMD on the night of 6 March and it arrived yesterday ( 9 March ) by DHL. Do you guys ordered on the UK site or MY site? I ordered on the MY site. The tracking still shows my item in the warehouse tho. No tracking number or whatsoever was provided.
Is you using express delivery?I ordered on MY site but the shoes directly from Uk warehouse
There is no express delivery on the delivery page so I chose standard delivery. My item was shipped from the UK too. Delivered by DHL.
Is direct link same with DHL delivery?cos I never heard before about any local direct link delivery company
not sure ..never heard of direct link

Add my suck experience from JD sports online store.I placed my order on 8th of Feb and until now I haven't received my parcel. the parcel is still at Malaysia custom.JD manager call me and promised will take back their shoes and refund, but until today (2 weeks pass), the status of shoes still with Custom, and City Link ask me to call Pos Malaysia. However Pos asked me to call Custom.And guess what, CUSTOM and POS said don't know about my parcel!!!!!!!
Did you manage to get it until now?
Can I know how you guys track your order ? Thanks ! ?
Bro how you check your item ? Cause I check using direct link it stated that the item is not available ? I Track using my order number
Looks like there's a mix of good, ok and bad reviews.Now I'm considering if I want to buy from their online store ...

I already bought Jordan from JD MY website on 1st April, and the status already on its way for the next day, but till today, 6th April I didnt got any update. Is is usual like this or what?  I need to know where exactly my shoe is, it is at custom or what...

I've had some good and some bad experiences with JD Online. Ordered a pair of Triple White NMDs from them; package and everything came on time, however the size that they sent to me was wrong. Gave them a quick call in the UK, told them about the issue, and they told me that they would reserve a pair of the correct size (because technically their fault for getting sending me the wrong size right?). They received my item on Tuesday and they mentioned that they have no records of saving / reserving the size for me, even though I called them about 4 - 5 days ago and the customer size guy over the phone told me that he'll put it down. So now, I'm hoping that I get a refund, cause the shoes plus the shipping cost wasn't cheap, and from reading reviews, some people in the UK got their refund, but those that paid via PayPal did not. (Anyone here with a JDSports UK refund story?)At the same time, my girlfriend was buying a pair as well from JDSports, and her order came on time and in the correct size (albeit the socks that she also ordered with the shoes were in the wrong size, can't be fussed about that, lol)So not too sure what's up with them, I think they need to change their warehouse manager and also their customer service team all together. I'm just hoping I didn't just lose out on RM 900 just like that due to shit customer service.

Update for everyone! I did manage to get a refund for the shoes I bought! The shoes got shipped back to JD UK Tuesday morning, and they've refunded it back to my credit card on Friday (as I'm typing this). However, they've yet to refund me shipping it back to them. Will update once again, next week to see if the shipping back has happened!

Good to know bro. I still haven't pulled the trigger.Went to Pyramid (on Saturday) and Mid Valley (on Sunday) and still couldn't get what I want! I'm looking for Air Presto Utility Low (Black).Pyramid didn't have my size (UK 12) while Mid Valley (which seems like a smaller outlet to me) didn't have Presto Utility Lows!Considering if I should get from JD Sports UK (older Utility color) or just get the regular Presto from NIKEiD and pay extra ... I'm guessing NIKE Malaysia "should" be more reliable?

Just sharing my experience...I bought a pair of NMD PK tricolor from Jd sports UK on 26 Dec 2016 and got it after 3 weeks (17 Jan 2017). I think it was the problem with the snail mail Swedish courier (Direct Link). My friend in singapore bought the exact same shoes from them on the same day but he got it within a week as they used a different courier (DPD UK). To be honest, JDsports UK's staff were quite helpful throughout when i PM them on fb. But yea the status update on their website was trash.My advice is that you can buy from JD sports online only if it's limited release like certain NMD primeknits or ultraboost or even jordans. Else it's not really worth the hassle.p.s. I didnt have issue with custom clearance/tax. I think if you buy 2 pairs or more, then the risk is higher.

You have to double confirm the tracking number with them. I know the problem with direct link is that sometimes they provide the wrong tracking number. Just pm Jdsports UK on fb and they would reply you shortly.

hmmm, I already bought 1 pair of shoes Adidas original superstar  from JD MY website on 04 April 2017, and the status already on its way, but till today, 11th April I didnt got any update. it's quite troubling.

This is quite worrying... I'm close to placing an order

I think if you buy from Nike website itself should be more reliable. IF I'm not mistaken, Nikes either ship from Singapore or Australia. Distance is shorter, and less customs. However, am not too sure if the product itself would ship straight from the US cause it's NikeID. But from what I've heard from friends, it's okay; not as a bad as JD. I think honestly I got really lucky with my shipment with JD Sports; despite having to send it back, they refunded me in due time; and recently they wanted to get my mobile number so that they can refund me the return costs by this week. An advice for everyone I guess, is to just call their customer service line everyday and push them to escalate your case after you've dropped them an email. Call at 4pm; which is UK 9am, and you'll usually be able to get someone on the phone with you. (Also protip, just use office phone to call, hahah)

Thanks for the tip - cost also plays a factor right now. Paying almost RM 200 more for something similar to what I can get from JD. The design/color I want (yes, I'm boring with boring colors chosen! HAHA!)

Yeah bro; that's true. but sometimes very hard to tell whether got good luck or not with things like this. I have a feeling that next time when I buy a new pair of shoes (probably looking for a pair Ultraboost after this; after my Racers and my NMDs); think I'll go with Facebook groups and some of my friends who are in this line of business, hahaha. I was pretty much anxious the whole entire time waiting for the refund to happen after reading countless of reviews not just from Malaysians, but from all over the world for JDSports. Plus I'm not in a rush to wear or buy anymore. I'm more of like a "when the time is right" kinda guy when it comes to sneakers. Hopefully all goes well with your order bro!

Thanks bro. I'm no a collector. Just want to get a nice comfy pair for my HK trip end of the year. So I'm not really in a rush. Just that I had a pair of original Prestos when I was studying in Melbourne back in 2001 - 2002 and really liked them. Got them from Foot Locker and also had a Foot Locker limited edition Black/Red Air Max 95 then. Still prefer the comfort of the Prestos. Such a hassle to find shoes that I like in Malaysia with my Size 13 US feet. Not only sneakers but leather work shoes as well! Been buying from Marks & Spencer only so far.
My order status right now :'Order customs cleared and lodged with local delivery agent'How many days it will arrive? Who knows?

I don't see any problem with JD online store except for their custom tax issue where they mistakenly stated GBP instead of MYR in their invoice. That's why we have to pay for the tax but it's refundable, just need to spam their fb / email lol. So far I personally ordered 3 pairs, and all 3 pairs received without any problem except for 1 which stated in GBP, and it took almost a week for them to refund me. Usually we'll get our shoe within 5-10 working days. I got 1 shoe within a week, while another 2 around 2weeks time. Ignore their website tracking status, it's crap cause mine still in warehouse status LOL, already received the shoe for almost 2months already. Hope this information helps! Cheers

I ordered from both site too before. UK site once and Malaysia site twice. Malaysia site one only got problem once where they stated GBP instead of MYR, so custom tax applied. But in the end JD refunded me too lol

So, just to share with everyone, my package arrived safely. No mistakes in size/color/billing etc. Box arrived a little beat up (I'm a collector of other stuff so box condition is important to me). No extra protection in a black wrap/bag. » Click to show Spoiler - click again to hide... «Free gift! » Click to show Spoiler - click again to hide... «Seems to be in good condition, but doesn't feel like my original Prestos felt (or at least, how I remembered it) especially the soles. I got my original Prestos when I was a student in Melbourne in 2001 - 2003 and they had sizing from S - XXL. And now they go by the normal sizing US 13, etc. Maybe I need to wear them for awhile to "break them in"...» Click to show Spoiler - click again to hide... «Based on this shopping experience (1st timer):PROs- 3 day delivery (for RM 50), ordered on 17th April, arrived on 20th April via DHL- no errors- availability, a color I wanted AND the size I wantedCONs- no extra protection for the box. They just stuffed it in a black bag and shipped it outI'd rate JD Sports Malaysia 4/5 stars   Hope the rest of you have the same good luck!
good sharing
Happy to share. Hope it helps in someone else's decision making process if they decide to order from their Webstore

UPDATE.Finally got my shoe today. Exactly 1mth from d day I place order.

Did you end up paying customs? I was informed the same by JD.Made my order last week and it just arrived at KLIA. JD mixed up the invoice amount and amount declared on airway. Got held at customs. Spoke to DHL and they ask me to send supporting of the price of the shoe. During the call I checked about customs duty and DHL confirmed I need to pay the duty.A little disaapointed with JD as they confirmed their DHL account is setup to absorb customs duty directly.I sent JD a message on FB and they just said sorry and to claim back from them. Hope I get my shoe this week.
Just received my ultra boost from jdsports.my thru DHL and was charged for gst rm120.Can I claim the gst charges to jdsports?Thank you.

was trying to look for ultra boost uncaged for long, no luck. I just saw JD MY has the UB 3.0, does it mean it available in store here? the price at UK is not cheaper by much...
Received my NMD..didn't have to pay custom duty. GST. Was 36 ringgit which DHL paid. Not bad, ordered and received within a week.

how many pairs did you order?

Hello Guys,I ordered 2 pairs and it came after 5 days.But DHL billed me 120RM for tax during delivery when i receive the item..now im processing a refund with JDsports support..
I asked JD to check from their system since they don't allowed me to give them details by email and I don't understand their accent lol
No , i din pay tax for DHL. they claim from JD directly.
Just one..I believe below 500 it's exempted for custom duty.

Ordered another pair of NMDs. Since last Friday it showed that it's shipped but on DHL tracker it showed as shipping information received but hasn't been collected from JD. Followed up and received all sort of answers from JD. Eventually they admitted that they can't track what happen to my order. So they are processing a refund. Couple of lesson learnt and hope it helps you guys.1) JD doesn't screw up all the time. My first order was smooth. But they don't have the tendency to screw up.2) if they screw up, their customer service responds promptly. You just need to be consistent and push them. I read earlier someone said spam their FB messenger ?3) Will I order again? Only if I can't find the shoe in store hereCheers!

The first shoes I bought from JD Sports UK was funny, I bought NMD last year November through website and waited for 2 weeks but still the products not yet reach to Malaysia.Then I complaint to them email and somehow they said the shoes might lost in transit and they agreed to refund to me. So I get my money back and then after 2 months I got a letter from custom that my shoes kept there. So I went there and paid custom for GST and get a free shoes.

My last experience with JDSports was purchasing a pair of Ultra BoostOrdered from JD UK siteEstimated time of shipping was between 6 - 10 working days.However my order did not arrive after more than 14 working days so I emailed them.The customer service said that they will refund the shipping cost back.My shoes arrived after almost 1 month (3 weeks plus). It was forwarded by Pos Malaysia normal post, not poslaju.Double checked the shipment sticker, it says it was shipped from JD Sweden via Swedish Postal Service. LOL.Did not get any tax.My shipping cost was credited back to my bank account (I used Maybank debit) after about 2 days receiving my item.
looks like worth to try using jdsports MY website. Now they are having SALE.

Just wanna share my experience buying from JD sport UK. It was really positive experience, ordered on 26jun, shipped and track with Skynet Worldwide on 28jun, and just now got the package (3 July). Really satisfied with my first buy..No issue with custom

How about don't? After they refunded the GST and DHL "tax", via PayPal (early May), they did a chargeback and take back all the money, and I was also fined by PayPal for RM30!!! So a total of more than RM150 lost!!!I'd sent them 3 emails (since mid-June), and nobody has bothered to reply... PLEASE DO NOT BUY FROM JDSPORTS.MY, THEY'RE BUNCH OF CHEATERS AND SCAMMERS...I'm not the only case as there others in some of the FB MY Boost groups... I still do not know what is the next best course of action now... Damnit!!!

few days too late discovering this threadi hope my shoes arrive soon. it said should only tame 5 days. today 2nd day. will update n review. ordered via jdsport MYEDIT : woot! just checked. status is DISPATCHED (Skynet)

Ordered from JD UK on 26june, just received my shoe via skynet worldwide. Pretty fast on UK side but got hold around in malaysia for an extra few days. Total taken 8days including weekend. 4.5/5stars for JD UK. Half star for no double box. Shoe Box look like some warehouse clearance leftover ??
